fields.headline: Rhubarb, rhubarb
fields.bodyText: "My experience of the RSC is this: you go into a large room at Stratford-upon-Avon with loads of bright lights and then shout at lots of Americans." Paul Bettany helps to explain his journey from stage to screen "You know the kind of pictures they used to make in [the 1960s]? Well, we are going to try and recreate that whole feel. We are even going to sit in open cars with obvious projection going on behind us. I loved those moments when the car is seen speeding round corners and no one driving is actually turning the steering wheel." Ewan McGregor on his next movie "Eighty-seven per cent of our business is people out of work and these award shows make people lonely. I don't think they're conducive to good work. I think they're counter productive. I think you should just work and put on the shows and leave it at that. I always find statuettes and awards hogwash." Actor Brian Blessed faces yet another year without an Oscar nomination "Everything the critics like I hate, and everything that they hate I like. I like light-hearted, girl flick, love story movies. It's easy to watch, not that deep." Britney Spears defends her debut movie Crossroads "What was the name of that fuckface from the East End - the one I told to go to Hollywood? Michael Caine, that's the one!" Veteran director Joan Littlewood
